Exaggerate: The claim may be seen as exaggerating the severity of COVID-19 by stating that it is the leading cause of death in the United States without considering other diseases or causes.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient support as it is based on a small window of data and does not take into account historical death trends or official numbers.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that COVID-19 is the leading cause of death in the United States without considering alternative explanations or factors.
Exist alternative explanation: The spokesperson for the National Center for Health Statistics disputes the claim, suggesting that there may be alternative explanations or interpretations of the data.
Falters at times: The claim may falter at times due to the limited data available on 2020 deaths by cause and the lack of final official numbers.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the statement from the spokesperson for the National Center for Health Statistics, who states that there is no data to support the theory that COVID-19 is the leading cause of death.
Understate: There is no evidence of underestimation bias in the provided claim.
